channel.title: Help with fishing
channel.description: Probably a simple fix, but when fishing and you walk away from the Fishing spot, the animation and the fishing continue no matter what you do, thanks for any help.

item.title: Help with fishing
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

In your walking packet just add the isFishing boolean somewhere

Another option is to make a skillResetVariable

so then you can just in the walking packet you can add

or whatever and it will automatically reset any skill you are working on

and I would also do the same for teleporting…wherever your teleporting method is just add the same variable there

Read full topic

item.title: Help with fishing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Here’s what I did to solve this (My system may be different than yours, but I know I had the same issue).

I added an array of booleans to player.java

public boolean[] playerSkilling = new boolean[24];

And I called them based off their skilling IDs. So if you were using attack, it would be playerSkilling[0] and so on.

Then in Fishing.java I made them set to true/false based off what I was doing:

c.playerSkilling[10] = true;//Just started fishing

And then in the stop method for my fishing (I use cycleEvents)

					public void stop() {
						resetFishing(c);
					}

resetFishing:

	public static void resetFishing(Client c) {
		c.startAnimation(65535);//Non-existent anim, so it will just reset your player to normal.
		c.getPA().removeAllWindows();//Clears any windows that may have been opened somehow
		c.playerSkilling[10] = false;//Set boolean to false
		for(int i = 0; i < 11; i++) {//Flush skill data
			c.playerSkillProp[10][i] = -1;
		}
	}

And then finally walking.java:

		if(c.playerSkilling[10] == true){
			c.playerSkilling[10] = false;
		}

This will My cycle event updates rather fast, and there’s multiple checks to see if it’s true, and it will never start when walking

Read full topic

item.title: Help with fishing
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

What RandQm said + you need to clear and flush.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with fishing
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

search for the boolean in your fishing method that holds whether you’re fishing or not.
probably just isFishing or similar.
Then in your walking packet declare the boolean as false (isFishing = false;)
and resetAnimation as well.

Read full topic
